ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Connection_zone_bare_die_interface_plane_relationship establishes a product structure relationship that may be represented in a geometric context for the purpose of deriving a 2D or 3D representation of the intersection of a terminal interface.

an associated_bare_die_terminal is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the is dependent on the the existence of the that specifies the as its seating_plane_zone. There shall be no more than one for a .
a derived_zone_shape_class specifies the text that describes the .
a derived_zone specifies the role of a for the .
a mating_zone specifies the role of a for the .
an interface_plane specifies the role of a for the .
The combination of interface_plane and mating_zone shall be unique within a population of .

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Bare_die is a type of a . A Bare_die is used to describe the physical shape and function of a semiconductor device.
ext_description.note: In the PCA domain an occurrence of a Bare_die may be installed into an occurrence of a to realize a , an occurrence of which is then mounted in the assembly. In this role of performing a function, a Bare_die has terminals.

In the PCB domain an occurrence of a Bare_die may be installed into the design of an to realize an embedded component. In this role, the external surfaces of the Bare_die will be important as they form part of the location information for the occurrence.

A Bare_die implements electrical functionality. It is not necessary to exchange Bare_die information for parts such as molded or ceramic resistors where there is not a separately identifiable and common industry understanding of a die.
In the PCA domain an occurrence of a Bare_die may be mounted directly onto the occurrence of a usage view of a PCB.
The existence of oxide or other thin contaminate protection is considered normal for a Bare_die.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the die_seating_plane is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Bare_die is dependent on the existence of the that is also a standard orientation reference for assembly purposes for the Bare_die. The is simulating a mounting surface.

the access_mechanisms is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Bare_die is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Bare_die as its . There shall be two or more for a Bare_die.
the implemented_function specifies the role of the for the Bare_die.

the maximum_material_condition_centroid_location specifies one role of the for the Bare_die. The maximum_material_condition_centroid_location is the center of mass for a bare die in the state that contains the most material. The maximum_material_condition_centroid_location need not be specified for a particular Bare_die.

the maximum_height_above_seating_plane specifies the role of the for the Bare_die. The maximum_height_above_seating_plane is the largest extent of the Bare_die above the die_seating_plane. The maximum_height_above_seating_plane need not be specified for a particular Bare_die.

the least_material_condition_centroid_location specifies one role of the for the Bare_die. The least_material_condition_centroid_location is the center of mass for a bare die in the minimum material state. The least_material_condition_centroid_location need not be specified for a particular Bare_die.
The function implemented shall be the function whose terminals are mapped to the terminals of the bare die.
There shall be a bare die category associated with the product the bare die is a definition for.
A Bare_die_bottom_surface is a type of .
A Bare_die_edge_segment_surface is a type of .
A Bare_die_edge_surface is a type of .
A Bare_die_surface is a type of . A Bare_die_surface is one of a , a , a , or a .
the associated_definition specifies the role of the for the .

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Bare_die_terminal is a type of . A Bare_die_terminal is the surface area on a that corresponds to the functional terminal on that .
ext_description.example: A in combination with a are populated to map the functionality of a to the functionality of the for the occurrence of the in the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the external_connection_area specifies the of the Bare_die_terminal. The external_connection_area is the area on the surface of a to which an electrically conducting material shall be attached to access the electrical functionality of the . There may be more than one for a Bare_die_terminal. The external_connection_area is optional and need not be supplied if the data is unavailable in the source system. If the data is available in the source system, it shall be supplied.
The inherited by the terminal may be the same that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole terminal is the .
the material specifies the role of the for the Bare_die_terminal.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Bare_die_top_surface is a type of .
A Guided_wave_bare_die_terminal is a type of used with guided waves in high frequency or fiber-optic applications.

A Minimally_defined_bare_die_terminal is a type of . A Minimally_defined_bare_die_terminal may be a or additionally may be a . The associated_definition specifies the to which the provides electrical access. A Minimally_defined_bare_die_terminal does not include location or shape information.
the associated_definition specifies the role of the for the Minimally_defined_bare_die_terminal.
